references: We consider an AirComp system with M𝑀M edge devices, each with a single antenna connected to the PS that is equipped with N𝑁N antennas. Multiple edge devices are allowed to transmit simultaneously on the same channel. The number of edge devices participating in the model update in each communication round is limited in order to minimize the distortion error and maximize the testing model performance. Assume the maximum number of selected devices for transmitting in each round is K𝐾K under AirComp[7]. The main notations used in the paper are summarized in Table I.

S3.T2.caption: TABLE II: Complexity Analysis
references: For each client, supposing the computation time to finish the ML task is tpsubscript𝑡𝑝t_{p}, the communication time for PS channel estimation is tosubscript𝑡𝑜t_{o} and the communication time to upload model gradients is tusubscript𝑡𝑢t_{u}. The corresponding time complexity is summarized in Table II.

references: In this section, we present the performance of federated learning under AirComp with different user scheduling schemes. The channel parameters are given as follows. There are M=1000𝑀1000M=1000 users uniformly distributed in a disk region with a cell size of 500500500 m. The transmit signal to noise ratio P​0σ2𝑃0superscript𝜎2\frac{P0}{\sigma^{2}} is fixed at 424242 dB, channel path loss exponent is α=3𝛼3\alpha=3. The number of antennas at PS is N=4𝑁4N=4. In each communication round, the channel vector keeps constant for the same user while it varies across different users and/or different communication rounds. We further have K=10𝐾10K=10 and W=20𝑊20W=20. The learning task is trained by using the MNIST (Modified National Institute of Standards and Technology) dataset [13] with a fully connected neural network called LeNet-300-100, where the first hidden layer consists of 300300300 neurons and the second layer consists of 100100100 neurons. The hyperparameters are summarized in Table III. The learning stages are divided into two phases, namely training phase and testing phase. Similarly, the dataset also split into two parts, 90%percent9090\% of them are training set and the rest are the testing set. The testing accuracy is used to evaluate the learning performance. To make the proposed scheduling schemes more convincing, non-i.i.d data [14] is used here, i.e., every user has a varying data size and distribution.
